section.title: Installing the OpenStack Dashboard
section.para: Here are the overall steps for creating the OpenStack dashboard. Details about deployment are available at Deploying Horizon.

listitem.para: Install the OpenStack Dashboard framework including Apache and related modules.
Restart and run the Apache server.

section.para: Install the OpenStack Dashboard, as root:

screen.userinput: yum install -y memcached python-memcached mod_wsgi openstack-dashboard
zypper install memcached python-python-memcached apache2-mod_wsgi openstack-dashboard

section.para: Next, modify the variable CACHE_BACKEND in /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings to match the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.conf. Open /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings and look for this line:

note.para: The address and port in the new value need to be equal to the ones set in /etc/memcached.conf/etc/sysconfig/memcached.

section.para: If you change the memcached settings, restart the Apache web server for the changes to take effect.

note.para: This guide has selected memcache as a session store for OpenStack Dashboard. There are other options available, each with benefits and drawbacks. Refer to the OpenStack Dashboard Session Storage section for more information.

In order to change the timezone you can use either dashboard or inside /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.py you can change below mentioned parameter.TIME_ZONE = "UTC"
